intro: Trichera arvensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved trichera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. This plant is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
